Description: Amulet, ear-ring and beads made of different materials. A: Highly stylized wedjat eye amulet in a flat and rounded shape with a ribbed edge in a turquoise greenish faience. One end of the perforation is chipped off and parts of the surface are eroded. The underside is flat while the upper side is slightly curved. B: Fragment of an ear-ring, made of white shell, the surface is well polished. C: Cylindrical segmented bead made of greenish faience in a poor quality. The body is tapered towards one end. D: Two ring beads made of turquoise faience, one is partly broken off, the other is partly eroded. E: Two disc beads made of ostrich eggshell, only roughly shaped, the perforation has been drilled from both sides. F: Segment of a roughly cylindrical bead made of some sort of glazed material in a cream to transparent colour. G: Two barrel-shaped beads made of an orange-yellow stone, one of them a bit darker and in a longer shape, the other a bit lighter and shorter. H: Spherical bead made of dark red glazed material.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
